dublin_core.dcvalue: With more than 1 billion Internet users worldwide the World Wide Web has inevitably made its mark on the global healthcare industry As a European Union EU nation Greece has not conducted many e health trend surveys due to the low penetration of the Internet and the continued belief among Greek consumers that the Internet cannot substitute for face to face contact with a physician Yet the extant literature does reveal a growing trend of Internet use for healthrelated information among Greek consumers over the past decade The purpose of this study is to survey the extent of Internet use for health related purposes among a representative sample of Greek consumers Results indicated that Internet use among Greek consumers is rising in comparison with past surveys Also Greek consumers who are young female and well educated seem to also trust health related information found on the Internet as well as following recommendations they get from online health related information
